description:
Rewrite is set in the fictional city Kazamatsuri, where treeplanting and afforestation have caused the city to become overgrown with trees and flowers in much the same way that other cities are filled by buildings. However, while most of the city appears to be rural, there are many traditional city elements as well. While set in a modern setting, the city also gives off a strange sense of nostalgia.

Tennouji Kotarou lives here. He's a high school student who has the ability to rewrite his own body; he can become stronger and faster at any time he chooses. He investigates supernatural mysteries with five girls from his school.

(Source: VNDB)

Note: The first episode aired with a runtime of 48 minutes as opposed to the standard 24 minute long episode.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

Representative director of [Bibury](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/). Often teams up with [Masayuki Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/116301/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tensho_tw) | [Website](http://tenshohp.web.fc2.com/)

Representative director of [Bibury](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/). Often teams up with [Masayuki Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/116301/).

Key is a Japanese visual novel studio. It is known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PROJECT_ROMEO)

Also known as Hajime Yamada (pseudonym). Romeo Tanaka is a male Japanese freelance artist and scenario writer for bishoujo games and adult games. He attended the University of Tsukuba. In 2007, Tanaka started to write his first light novel series entitled Jinrui wa Suitaishimashita which is published by Shogakukan. He is notable for having a hand in the creation of works such as Kana ~Imouto~, Cross†Channel and Saihate no IMA, and co-authored the scenario for Key's game Rewrite.

Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)
**Masato Takahashi** is a Japanese CG director and CG designer who also does photography.
Musical composer, widely known for his work in Air TV, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, and other Key pieces.

__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

Website Satou Tenshou is a Japanese animator, formerly belonging to Studio Wanpack, now a member of White Fox. His favourite anime are Sennen Joyuu, Kidou Senshi Gundam: Gyakushuu no Char, and Onegai Teacher. His nickname is MacGuyver. Having only served as an animator since Gad Guard he has shown to be proficient at displaying flowing stuff and its linework as well as excelling at storyboarding and portraying a good sense of camera action.
